intro: Gymnolomia annua, commonly known as the annual gymnolomia, is an herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or along stream banks. Gymnolomia annua is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
